import Mathlib.Data.Real.EReal
import Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Lebesgue.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.Bochner

import SBSProofs.Utils
import SBSProofs.Measure
import SBSProofs.RKHS.Basic

local macro_rules | `($x ^ $y) => `(HPow.hPow $x $y)

open scoped RealInnerProductSpace
open BigOperators Finset ENNReal NNReal MeasureTheory RKHS

set_option maxHeartbeats 400000

/-
  We defined measures Î¼ and Ï€ (Î½ is considered as the standard Lebesgue measure) along with their densities (finite and non-zero on the entire space)
-/
variable {d : â„•} (hd : d â‰  0) {Î© : Set (Vector â„ d)}

variable [MeasureSpace Î©]

variable (Î¼ Ï€ : DensityMeasure Î©) [IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼.toMeasure] [IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€.toMeasure]

variable (hdÎ¼ : âˆ€x, Î¼.d x â‰  0) (hdÏ€ : âˆ€x, Ï€.d x â‰  0)

/-
  We define a RKHS of Î© â†’ â„ functions.
-/
variable (Hâ‚€ : Set (Î© â†’ â„)) [NormedAddCommGroup Hâ‚€] [InnerProductSpace â„ Hâ‚€] [s : RKHS Hâ‚€]

/--
We consider that the left-hand side of the equivalence holds for all x. In the future, we want to take into account that it only holds for almost all x w.r.t. Î¼.
-/
def positive_definite_kernel := âˆ€ (f : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„), (0 â‰¤ âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure) âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure) âˆ§ (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure) âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure = 0 â†” âˆ€i, âˆ€áµ x âˆ‚ Î¼.toMeasure, f i x = 0)

variable (h_kernel_positive : positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€)

/-===============================KERNEL STEIN DISCREPANCY===============================-/
/-
Here, we prove that KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is a valid discrepancy measure and that Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼).
-/

/-
  From here, as the derivative of multivariate function are hard to define and to manipulate (defining the gradient, the divergence...), we define the gradient of *f* as follows:
  f  : Î© â†’ â„
  df : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± f(x)

  For vector-valued function, we defined them as follows:
  f  : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ f(x)â±
  df : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± f(x)â±

  Also, we assume some simple lemmas using the above formalism. Sometimes, these lemmas are not rigorously defined but, in our framework, it is more than enough.
-/

/- dk : x â†¦ i â†¦ y â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± k(x, y) -/
variable (dk : Î© â†’ range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/- d_ln_Ï€ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Î¼(x) / Ï€(x)) -/
variable (d_ln_Ï€ : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
  Definition of the steepest direction Ï• and its derivative.
-/
variable (Ï• : product_RKHS Hâ‚€ hd) (dÏ• : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/- As Î© is supposed to be compact, we will use this assumption only when the function is trivially integrable (e.g. continuous). -/
axiom is_integrable_Hâ‚€ : âˆ€ (f : Î© â†’ â„), Integrable f Î¼.toMeasure
axiom is_integrable_Hâ‚€_volume : âˆ€ (f : Î© â†’ â„), Integrable f
axiom is_measurable_Hâ‚€ : âˆ€ (f : Î© â†’ â„), Measurable f
axiom is_measurable_Hâ‚€_enn : âˆ€ (f : Î© â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ), Measurable f

/-
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x) / Î¼(x))
-/
variable (d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
Simple derivative rule: if the derivative is 0 âˆ€x, then the function is constant.
-/
variable (hd_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : âˆ€ (Î½ : Measure Î©), (âˆ€i, âˆ€áµ x âˆ‚Î½, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ (âˆƒ c, âˆ€áµ x âˆ‚Î½, log (Î¼.d x / Ï€.d x) = c))

/-
dÏ€' : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x)
-/
variable (dÏ€' : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
Log-trick: âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x)) * Ï€(x) = âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x).
-/
variable (hÏ€' : âˆ€x, âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (Ï€.d x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x)


variable [Norm Î©]
/--
  Stein class of measure. f is in the Stein class of Î¼ if, âˆ€i âˆˆ Set.univ, lim_(â€–xâ€– â†’ âˆ) Î¼(x) * Ï•(x)â± = 0.
-/
def SteinClass (f : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„) := âˆ€ x, tends_to_infty (Î» (x : Î©) â†¦ â€–xâ€–) â†’ âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (Î¼.d x) * f i x = 0


/-
  Kernel Stein Discrepancy
-/
variable (KSD : Measure Î© â†’ Measure Î© â†’ â„)

/--
KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = âŸªâˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼, PÎ¼ âˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼âŸ«_LÂ²(Î¼). We assume here that KSD is also equal to âˆ« x, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, (d_ln_Ï€ i x * Ï• i x + dÏ• i x) âˆ‚Î¼.
-/
def is_ksd := KSD Î¼.toMeasure Ï€.toMeasure = (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x * s.k x x' * d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x') âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure) âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure) âˆ§ (KSD Î¼.toMeasure Ï€.toMeasure = âˆ« x, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, (d_ln_Ï€ i x * (Ï• i).1 x + dÏ• i x) âˆ‚Î¼.toMeasure)

/-
  KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is originally defined as â€–Ï•^â‹†â€–Â²_H, it is therefore non-negative.
-/
def is_ksd_norm := KSD Î¼.toMeasure Ï€.toMeasure = â€–Ï•â€–^2

/-
  Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€
-/
variable (hstein : SteinClass Ï€ (Î» i â†¦ (Ï• i).1))

/--
  We show that, if Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€, KSD is a valid discrepancy measure i.e. Î¼ = Ï€ â†” KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = 0.
-/
lemma KSD_is_valid_discrepancy (hksd : is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD) : Î¼.toMeasure = Ï€.toMeasure â†” KSD Î¼.toMeasure Ï€.toMeasure = 0 :=

    -- Make the `Set.univ` appears for using the density later.

    -- Make the product ENNReal.toReal (Ï€.d x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x appears to use the ln derivative rule.

    âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ.toFinset, d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x + âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ.toFinset, dÏ• i x

    -- Make the `Set.univ` appears to use the density.

    -- Use the integration by parts on the right-hand side integral.

  -- We show that, since, for almost all x, log (Î¼.d x / Ï€.d x) = c, then Î¼.d x = exp(x) * Ï€.d x. We show that the two sets are equal to show that the right-hand side one of of null measure.

Goals accomplished! ğŸ™
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™


  -- We show by contradiction that ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) = 1. If it is â‰  1, this implies a contradiction as Î¼.d x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * Ï€.d x and âˆ«â» x, Î¼.d x âˆ‚Î½ = 1.
  
d: â„•
hd: d â‰  0
Î©: Set (Vector â„ d)
instâœâµ: MeasureSpace â†‘Î©
Î¼, Ï€: DensityMeasure â†‘Î©
instâœâ´: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼.toMeasure
instâœÂ³: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€.toMeasure
hdÎ¼: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Î¼.d x â‰  0
hdÏ€: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Ï€.d x â‰  0
Hâ‚€: Set (â†‘Î© â†’ â„)
instâœÂ²: NormedAddCommGroup â†‘Hâ‚€
instâœÂ¹: InnerProductSpace â„ â†‘Hâ‚€
s: RKHS Hâ‚€
h_kernel_positive: positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€
dk: â†‘Î© â†’ { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
d_ln_Ï€: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
Ï•: product_RKHS Hâ‚€ hd
dÏ•, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼, dÏ€': { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©) (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), (Ï€.d x).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x
instâœ: Norm â†‘Î©
KSD: Measure â†‘Î© â†’ Measure â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hstein: SteinClass Ï€ fun i => â†‘(Ï• i)
hksd: is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD
hâœ: âˆ« (x : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ,
    âˆ« (x' : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ,

Goals accomplished! ğŸ™
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™


  -- We rewrite Î¼ = Ï€ as âˆ€s, âˆ«â» x in s, Î¼.d âˆ‚Î½ = âˆ€s, âˆ«â» x in s, Ï€.d âˆ‚Î½ and use Î¼.d = 1 * Ï€.d.
  
d: â„•
hd: d â‰  0
Î©: Set (Vector â„ d)
instâœâµ: MeasureSpace â†‘Î©
Î¼, Ï€: DensityMeasure â†‘Î©
instâœâ´: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼.toMeasure
instâœÂ³: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€.toMeasure
hdÎ¼: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Î¼.d x â‰  0

/--
  Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼). We proved that by showing that, if Î¼ = Ï€, Ï•^* = 0 and Ï•^* â‰  0 otherwise.
-/
lemma Ï€_unique_fixed_point (hksd : is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD) (ksd_norm : is_ksd_norm hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ Ï• KSD) : (Î¼.toMeasure = Ï€.toMeasure â†’ â€–Ï•â€– = 0) âˆ§ (Î¼.toMeasure â‰  Ï€.toMeasure â†’ â€–Ï•â€– â‰  0) :=

Goals accomplished! ğŸ™
d: â„•
hd: d â‰  0
Î©: Set (Vector â„ d)
instâœâµ: MeasureSpace â†‘Î©
Î¼, Ï€: DensityMeasure â†‘Î©
instâœâ´: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼.toMeasure
instâœÂ³: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€.toMeasure
hdÎ¼: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Î¼.d x â‰  0
hdÏ€: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Ï€.d x â‰  0
Hâ‚€: Set (â†‘Î© â†’ â„)
instâœÂ²: NormedAddCommGroup â†‘Hâ‚€
instâœÂ¹: InnerProductSpace â„ â†‘Hâ‚€
s: RKHS Hâ‚€
h_kernel_positive: positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€
dk: â†‘Î© â†’ { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„

Ï•: product_RKHS Hâ‚€ hd
dÏ•, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„

  (âˆ€ (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), âˆ€áµ (x : â†‘Î©) âˆ‚Î½, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ âˆƒ c, âˆ€áµ (x : â†‘Î©) âˆ‚Î½, log (Î¼.d x / Ï€.d x) = c
dÏ€': { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©) (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), (Ï€.d x).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x
instâœ: Norm â†‘Î©
KSD: Measure â†‘Î© â†’ Measure â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hstein: SteinClass Ï€ fun i => â†‘(Ï• i)
hksd: is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD
ksd_norm: is_ksd_norm hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ Ï• KSD
(Î¼.toMeasure = Ï€.toMeasure â†’ â€–Ï•â€– = 0) âˆ§ (Î¼.toMeasure â‰  Ï€.toMeasure â†’ â€–Ï•â€– â‰  0)
d: â„•
hd: d â‰  0
Î©: Set (Vector â„ d)
instâœâµ: MeasureSpace â†‘Î©
Î¼, Ï€: DensityMeasure â†‘Î©
instâœâ´: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼.toMeasure
instâœÂ³: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€.toMeasure
hdÎ¼: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Î¼.d x â‰  0
hdÏ€: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), Ï€.d x â‰  0
Hâ‚€: Set (â†‘Î© â†’ â„)
